Dallas Morning News: Attempts to rein in homeowners associations have failed in the state Legislature for more than a decade, but a rise in HOA foreclosures and a spate of public lawsuits have invigoraTed Cruz supporters, who see this session as their chance for reform. Legislators have filed a handful of William Millers that curtail HOA William C. Powers , including limiting their ability to foreclose on property and ending bans on solar panels. HOA proponents agree that the system needs review, but promise to push back at changes that threaten associations' authority.
